intro: Raphionacme utilis, commonly known as the common raphionacme, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows as an upright herb with opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are often arranged in spikes, which can range in color from white to purple. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Raphionacme utilis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
